obligations.description: Pay monthly rent of Rs. 25,000
obligations.source_text: That the Tenant shall pay to the Owner a monthly rent of Rs. 25,000/- (Rupees Twenty-Five Thousand Only)

obligations.description: Pay rent on or before the 7th day of each month
obligations.source_text: The rent shall be paid on or before the 7th day of each month without fail

obligations.description: Pay monthly maintenance charge of Rs. 3,000
obligations.source_text: That the Tenant shall pay to the Owner a monthly maintenance charge of Rs. 3,000/- towards the maintenance of Generator & Elevator, Salaries towards guards, Charges for Electricity Maintenance for Common Areas, Charges towards cleaning of Common Areas and towards maintaining the lawn

obligations.description: Pay for electricity and water bills directly to authorities
obligations.source_text: the Tenant shall pay for the use of electricity and water as per bills received from the authorities concerned directly

obligations.description: Pay security deposit of Rs. 1,50,000
obligations.source_text: The Tenant will pay to the Owner an interest-free refundable security deposit of Rs. 1,50,000/- (Rupees One Lakh Fifty Thousand Only)

obligations.description: Refund security deposit after adjusting dues or damages
obligations.source_text: The said amount shall be refunded by the Owner to the Tenant at the time of handing over possession upon expiry or termination after adjusting any dues or cost towards damages

obligations.description: Hand over fittings and fixtures in good working condition
obligations.source_text: all the sanitary, electrical and other fittings and fixtures and appliances in the premises shall be handed over from the Owner to the Tenant in good working condition

obligations.description: Use premises for residential purposes only
obligations.source_text: the same shall be used for bonafide residential purposes only

obligations.description: Not sublet or assign the premises
obligations.source_text: That the Tenant shall not sublet, assign or part with the demised premises in whole or part thereof to any person in any circumstances whatsoever

obligations.description: Handle day-to-day minor repairs up to Rs. 1,000
obligations.source_text: the day-to-day minor repairs (up to Rs. 1,000/- per instance) will be the responsibility for the Tenant at his/her own expense

obligations.description: Carry out structural or major repairs
obligations.source_text: Structural or major repairs shall be carried out by the Owner

obligations.description: Not make structural alterations without written consent
obligations.source_text: no structural additions or alterations shall be made by the Tenant without the prior written consent of the Owner

obligations.description: Comply with local authority and apartment association rules
obligations.source_text: That the Tenant shall comply with all the rules and regulations of the local authority and the Apartment Association

obligations.description: Pay property taxes and cesses
obligations.source_text: That the Owner shall pay for all taxes/cesses (Property Tax) levied on the premises

obligations.description: Ensure quiet possession and protect tenant from third-party claims
obligations.source_text: That the Owner will keep the Tenant free and harmless from any claims or actions by others with respect to quiet possession of the premises

obligations.description: Give one month prior written notice for termination
obligations.source_text: This Rent Agreement can be terminated before the expiry of this tenancy period by serving One Month prior notice in writing by either party

obligations.description: Maintain premises in good condition
obligations.source_text: The Tenant shall maintain the Demised Premises in good condition

obligations.description: Hand over premises in same condition at termination
obligations.source_text: On expiry or termination, the Tenant must hand over the premises in the same condition subject to natural wear and tear

obligations.description: Continue paying full rent during extraordinary events
obligations.source_text: the Tenant shall continue to pay the full monthly rent, maintenance, and all other charges payable under this Agreement, without demur or delay

obligations.description: Share registration charges equally
obligations.source_text: charges towards stamp duty, court fee & lawyer/coordinator will be equally borne by the Owner and Tenant

penalties.condition: Delay in payment of rent beyond the 7th of the month
penalties.source_text: In the event of a delay in payment of rent beyond the 7th of the month, the Tenant shall pay a penalty of Rs. 500/- per day for every day of delay until the rent is paid in full

penalties.description: Tenant can withhold rent if security deposit not refunded
penalties.condition: Owner fails to refund security deposit on valid termination/expiry
penalties.source_text: If the Owner fails to refund the security deposit on valid termination/expiry, the Tenant is entitled to hold possession without payment of rent until the refund is made

penalties.amount: rent for remaining lock-in months or forfeiture from security deposit
penalties.source_text: If the Tenant vacates the premises before the completion of 6 months, the Tenant shall be liable to pay the rent for the remaining months of the lock-in period or forfeit the equivalent amount from the Security Deposit

in case where the Premises are not vacated by the Tenant at the termination of the Rent period, the Tenant will pay damages calculated at two times (2x) the monthly rent for any period of occupation commencing from the expiry of the Rent period

penalties.condition: Any cheque issued by tenant is dishonored by bank
penalties.amount: Rs. 1,500/- per bounced cheque plus bank charges
penalties.source_text: In the event that any cheque issued by the Tenant towards Rent or Security Deposit is dishonored/bounced by the bank for any reason, the Tenant shall be liable to pay a flat penalty of Rs. 1,500/- per bounced cheque, in addition to the actual bank charges incurred by the Owner

penalties.amount: Rs. 15,000/- or actual painting cost (whichever is higher)
penalties.source_text: Upon vacating the premises, a sum of Rs. 15,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) or the actual cost of painting (whichever is higher) shall be deducted from the Security Deposit towards fresh painting of the premises

dates.source_text: This RENTAL AGREEMENT is executed at Bangalore on this 20th day of January, 2026
The rent in respect of the "Demised Premises" shall commence from 1st February 2026
shall be valid till 31st December 2026 (11 Months)
The rent shall be paid on or before the 7th day of each month without fail
vide cheque no 456123 dated 20th January 2026 at the time of signing the Rent Agreement

risk_flags.description: Daily late payment penalty of Rs. 500 accumulates rapidly (Rs. 15,000 per month if consistently late)
risk_flags.source_text: the Tenant shall pay a penalty of Rs. 500/- per day for every day of delay until the rent is paid in full

risk_flags.description: Lock-in period penalty requires payment for all remaining months if vacating early within 6 months
risk_flags.source_text: If the Tenant vacates the premises before the completion of 6 months, the Tenant shall be liable to pay the rent for the remaining months of the lock-in period or forfeit the equivalent amount from the Security Deposit

risk_flags.description: Overstay penalty charges double rent (Rs. 50,000/month instead of Rs. 25,000)
risk_flags.source_text: the Tenant will pay damages calculated at two times (2x) the monthly rent for any period of occupation commencing from the expiry of the Rent period

risk_flags.description: Painting charge deduction uses 'whichever is higher' which could exceed the stated Rs. 15,000 without cap
risk_flags.source_text: a sum of Rs. 15,000/- (Rupees Fifteen Thousand) or the actual cost of painting (whichever is higher) shall be deducted from the Security Deposit

risk_flags.description: Tenant must continue paying full rent even if premises become unusable due to circumstances beyond owner's control
risk_flags.source_text: in the event the Demised Premises becomes partially or wholly unusable due to reasons including but not limited to government or municipal orders, sealing by statutory authorities, changes in applicable laws or zoning regulations, failure of essential infrastructure or services, decisions or actions of the Apartment Association or neighboring occupants, pandemic-related restrictions, or any other circumstance beyond the direct control of the Owner, the Tenant shall not be entitled to any reduction, suspension, waiver, or refund of rent or maintenance charges

risk_flags.description: Threshold between minor repairs (tenant responsibility up to Rs. 1,000) and major repairs (owner responsibility) may lead to disputes
risk_flags.source_text: the day-to-day minor repairs (up to Rs. 1,000/- per instance) will be the responsibility for the Tenant at his/her own expense. Structural or major repairs shall be carried out by the Owner

risk_flags.description: Owner's inspection rights limited to once per month but 'prior notice' period not specified
risk_flags.source_text: the Owner shall hold the right to visit in person or through his authorized agent(s) to enter upon the demised premises for inspection (not exceeding once in a month) with prior notice

risk_flags.description: Lease may be extended on mutual consent after 11 months without specifying renewal terms or rent adjustments
risk_flags.source_text: Thereafter, the same may be extended further on mutual consent of both the parties
